Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Core-facilitated transport after passing through the shell

Other Information.Additional Info: PX shows rapid diffusion into the core after passing through the shell.
MX diffusion is restricted by the narrow pores of the shell.
OX diffusion is significantly hindered by the shell layer.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale facilitated by core-shell structure

Experimental Validation.Method: Vapor-phase adsorption, liquid-phase batch adsorption, fixed-bed breakthrough experiments, molecular dynamics simulations
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: PX/MX selectivity: 10.1 (Henry's selectivity), PX/OX selectivity: 17.2 (Henry's selectivity); Dynamic selectivities in breakthrough experiments: PX/MX = 3.0, PX/OX = 4.7

Other Information.Additional Info: The core-shell strategy amplifies diffusion differences between xylene isomers, achieving superior separation performance compared to individual components.
